title: One For All will soon return to the workshop

replies.body: I really wish there was a category for these modes: All for One, URF, Hexakill, so they can be played whenever and not once a year. Like how COD has Gun Game and Infected modes that are divided into their own group of "fun" type modes.
I dont think everything should be always available. But i think ONE special mode should always be able to play. Like rotate them.
I think this is a GREAT idea- add it to some sort of rotation of all the modes- that way people always have something to warm up on that isn't ARAM, but it keeps them from getting really repetitive.
Upvote this idea!
Up vote this comment!

I don't mind them being featured for limited times, it kind of makes it more special, but at the very least they could let us use it in custom created games, sure you'd have to find people to fill the game, and wont get a queue timer for it, but let people choose options, or even just change some of the rules like starting gold, or starting level, allow for duplicate champs, stuff like that in the screen for making a custom and just let people create stuff, might even get something new out of it. Custom games are all for fun anyway, half the time you don't get much reward from them anyway, might as well open them up with more options.
I also agree with your idea
U GENIUS WE MUST ALL GET RIOT'S ATTENTION
I have seen this mentioned every time a mode is going away. It is always a good idea, but it seems like Rito doesn't agree.

The point of the limited time for the game modes is so that you'll enjoy it more for the little time you have it, besides if all of these game modes were always there we'd probably get sick of them and just think of them like an aram or something along those lines.

The problem with always having one of these fun game modes to play is that they will have to have more work done balancing them. The other problem is that people will lose the attraction quickly and become "another ARAM" 

This could be solved by.... Customizing your own games! ARAM would be easy to set up on Summoners Rift if you could simply have the option to disable top and bot Lane minions. Maybe teams could be changed from 1 to 6 players for 1v1s or hexakill on any map. Character selection could be set to blind, draft or free pick or something. You could disable characters, items, or whatever you wanted when you set it up. 

Unfortunately, Riot has stated that it won't feature this kind of customization. This is a bad decision. All of Riot's competitors have options similar to this. Gamers, especially PC gamers, looooove to customize options and settings (hint, more key mapping options). As my game design teacher says (when talking about our one-week mini flash games): "That's a boolean! Barely a line of code!" And it can broaden the range of your player base massively.
Dammit Riot. Keep these around. Its nice to play custom games like this. I know I would play more often.
Time to wait for URF!
